intro: Ophrys tommasinii subsp. muellneri, commonly known as the Mullner's orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It is characterized by its intricate floral structure, which features a labellum that mimics the appearance of female insects to attract male pollinators. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine habitats. It has a short flowering period, usually in late spring, and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
